availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William P. Shephard (Louisville, KY, coach maker and salesman)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, coach maker and salesman. Virginia native. Married to Eliza Shephard. Father of Annie Shephard, Isaac Shephard, Emma Shephard, and Theodore Shephard. Coach maker in Louisville in 1860. Employed Isaac Shephard as a coach painter in Louisville in 1860. Salesman in Louisville in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 4, p. 58
Henry Tanner, ed., The Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1861 (Louisville: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1861), 224.
